security_audit.summary: This is a pure computational financial modeling skill with no file I/O, network access, environment variable reads, or external command execution. The code performs standard financial calculations (DCF, WACC, sensitivity analysis) using numpy and pandas. All data flows through function parameters and return values only.

content.user_title: Build DCF Models and Run Sensitivity Analysis
content.value_statement: Financial modeling requires complex calculations that are error-prone when done manually. This skill provides automated DCF valuation, sensitivity testing, and scenario analysis to support investment decisions with rigorous quantitative methods.
actual_capabilities: Calculate enterprise and equity values using discounted cash flow methodology
Compute weighted average cost of capital (WACC) from market inputs
Perform one-way and two-way sensitivity analysis on valuation drivers
Generate tornado charts showing relative impact of key variables
Analyze multiple scenarios with probability-weighted outcomes
Calculate terminal value using perpetuity growth or exit multiple methods
limitations: Does not fetch real-time market data or stock prices
Does not access external financial databases or APIs
Requires user-provided historical financials and assumption inputs
Models are computational tools and do not constitute financial advice

prompt_templates.title: Basic DCF Valuation
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a DCF model for a company with revenue of 1000M, EBITDA of 200M, capex of 50M, and NWC of 100M. Use 5-year projections with 10% annual growth, 20% EBITDA margin, 3% terminal growth, and WACC of 10%.

prompt_templates.title: Sensitivity Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a two-way sensitivity analysis on this DCF model testing WACC from 8% to 12% and terminal growth from 2% to 4%. Show how enterprise value changes across these ranges.

prompt_templates.title: Scenario Comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Create three scenarios for this company: base case with current trends, bull case with 25% growth acceleration, and bear case with 10% decline. Calculate probability-weighted expected value assuming 50% base, 30% bull, 20% bear probabilities.

prompt_templates.title: Full Valuation Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a complete DCF model with WACC calculation using risk-free rate of 4%, beta of 1.2, market premium of 7%, cost of debt of 5%, and debt-to-equity of 0.5. Include sensitivity analysis on growth rate and discount rate. Generate a summary report with key valuation metrics.

output_examples.input: Build a DCF model for TechCorp with 3 years of historical data: revenue 800, 900, 1000; EBITDA 160, 189, 220; capex 40, 45, 50; NWC 80, 90, 100. Use 5-year projections with declining growth rates from 15% to 6%.

best_practices: Always document your assumptions clearly, including growth rates, margin expectations, and terminal value methodology
Run sensitivity analysis on the most impactful variables before finalizing investment recommendations
Cross-validate DCF results with comparable company analysis and precedent transactions
anti_patterns: Using unrealistic terminal growth rates that exceed long-term GDP growth
Ignoring sensitivity to WACC, which can dramatically change valuation outcomes
Failing to stress test extreme scenarios that could impair investment thesis

faq.question: Does this skill connect to live market data?
faq.answer: No, this skill performs calculations on data you provide. You supply historical financials and assumptions, and the skill handles the mathematical modeling.

faq.question: What financial metrics can it calculate?
faq.answer: It handles enterprise value, equity value, WACC, free cash flow projections, terminal value, and sensitivity tables for key drivers.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with other tools or APIs?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill provides Python functions you can import and combine with data fetching pipelines or visualization tools.

faq.question: Is my financial data kept private?
faq.answer: Yes, all calculations happen locally with your data. No information is sent to external servers beyond the AI request context.

faq.question: Why is my valuation sensitive to certain inputs?
faq.answer: The skill includes sensitivity analysis functions that identify which assumptions have the largest impact on enterprise value, helping you focus on critical drivers.

faq.question: How does this compare to Excel financial models?
faq.answer: This provides programmatic financial modeling with consistent calculations. It complements Excel by offering reproducible code that can be version-controlled and tested.
